titles.en: Chapter 9 – Merits of the water of Euphrates (Al-Furat)
Chapter 9 – Merits of the water of Euphrates (Al-Furat)

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا إِخَالُ أَحَداً يُحَنَّكُ بِمَاءِ الْفُرَاتِ إِلَّا أَحَبَّنَا أَهْلَ الْبَيْتِ وَ قَالَ ( عليه السلام ) مَا سُقِيَ أَهْلُ الْكُوفَةِ مَاءَ الْفُرَاتِ إِلَّا لِأَمْرٍ مَا وَ قَالَ يُصَبُّ فِيهِ مِيزَابَانِ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Al Husayn Bin Usman, form Muhammad Bin Abu Hamza, from the one who mentioned it, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no one who is welcomed (newborn) with the water of the Euphrates except that he would love us<sup>asws</sup> the People<sup>asws</sup> of the Household’. And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The people of Al-Kufa do not quench themselves with the water of Euphrates except for a matter’. And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Therein diffuse two water-spouts from the paradise’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ يُدْفَقُ فِي الْفُرَاتِ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ دُفُقَاتٌ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ibn Bukeyr, from one of our companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There burst into the Euphrates every day, bursts from the (water of) Paradise’.

verses.text:
مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنِ ابْنِ أُورَمَةَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) نَهَرُكُمْ هَذَا يَعْنِي مَاءَ الْفُرَاتِ يَصُبُّ فِيهِ مِيزَابَانِ مِنْ مَيَازِيبِ الْجَنَّةِ 
قَالَ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَوْ كَانَ بَيْنَنَا وَ بَيْنَهُ أَمْيَالٌ لَأَتَيْنَاهُ وَ نَسْتَسْقِي بِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ali Bin Al Husayn, from Ibn Awrama, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, raising it who said, 
‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This river of yours, meaning the water of Euphrates, two water-spouts pour into it, from the spouts of the Paradise’.
He (the narrator) said, ‘So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Had there (not) been  miles between us<sup>asws</sup> and it, we<sup>asws</sup> would have gone to it, and we<sup>asws</sup> would have quenched ourselves by it’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) كَمْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَ بَيْنَ الْفُرَاتِ فَأَخْبَرْتُهُ فَقَالَ لَوْ كُنْتُ عِنْدَهُ لَأَحْبَبْتُ أَنْ آتِيَهُ طَرَفَيِ النَّهَارِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ali Bin Al Husayn, raising it, said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘How much (distance) is there between you and the Euphrates?’ So I informed him<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If I<sup>asws</sup> was in its presence, I<sup>asws</sup> would have loved to go to it at two ends of the day’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى جَمِيعاً عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ سَعْدَانَ عَنْ غَيْرِ وَاحِدٍ رَفَعُوهُ إِلَى أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ أَمَا إِنَّ أَهْلَ الْكُوفَةِ لَوْ حَنَّكُوا أَوْلَادَهُمْ بِمَاءِ الْفُرَاتِ لَكَانُوا شِيعَةً لَنَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, and Muhammad Bin Yahya, altogether from Ahmad Bin Is’haq, from Sa’dan, from someone else, 
(It has been narrated) raising it to Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘As for the people of Al-Kufa, had they welcomed their children (newborns) with the water of the Euphrates, they would have been our<sup>asws</sup> Shiah’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَكِيمِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ سَيِّدَنَا عَلِيَّ بْنَ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ مَلَكاً يَهْبِطُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ مَعَهُ ثَلَاثَةُ مَثَاقِيلَ مِسْكاً مِنْ مِسْكِ الْجَنَّةِ فَيَطْرَحُهَا فِي الْفُرَاتِ وَ مَا مِنْ نَهَرٍ فِي شَرْقِ الْأَرْضِ وَ لَا غَرْبِهَا أَعْظَمَ بَرَكَةً مِنْهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from one of our companions, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Bin Fazzal, from Hanan Bin Sudeyr, from his father, from Hakeem Bin Jubeyr who said, 
‘I heard our Master Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘An Angel descends from the sky during every night, with him being three ounces of musk from the musk of the Paradise, so he casts it in the Euphrates, and there is none from a river in the east of the earth nor in the west of it with a Blessing greater than it’.
